snippet: Setting up a Supreme Court case, the decision overturned lower court rulings in Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio and Tennessee that were in favor of same-sex marriage.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Cincinnati, in 2-1 decision, upholds rights of Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio and Tennessee to ban same-sex marriage, overturning lower court rulings and almost certainly sending issue quickly to Supreme Court; Judge Jeffrey S Sutton, writing much-anticipated decision, says change should be decided by 'work of the state democratic processes.'
lead_paragraph: Setting up a Supreme Court case, the decision overturned lower court rulings in Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio and Tennessee that were in favor of same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Court Upholds Marriage Bans in Four States
headline.print_headline: Court Upholds Marriage Bans in Four States

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
